description: n + reversal of base 2 digits of n (written in base 10).
comments: If n has an even number of digits in base 2 then a(n) is a multiple of 3.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{id = IntegerDigits[n, 2]}, FromDigits[id + Reverse@id, 2]]; Array[f, 69, 0] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 07 2010 *)
prog: (Haskell)a055944 n = n + a030101 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 14 2011
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 18 2000
